byline.contributor: Merna Thomas reported from Cairo, and David D. Kirkpatrick from London. Jared Malsin contributed reporting from Cairo, and Elisabeth Malkin from Mexico City.
byline.original: By MERNA THOMAS and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

abstract: Egyptian military helicopter mistakenly opens fire on Mexican tourists southwest of Cairo, believing they were Islamic militants, killing at least 12 people and wounding 10 others; error points up Egypt's failure to establish public security and threatens country's tourism industry.
lead_paragraph: The attack in broad daylight by a helicopter raised new questions about the competence of security forces and the prevalence of the militants they were hunting.

headline.main: Egyptian Military Fires on Mexican Tourists During Picnic
headline.print_headline: Troops’ Mistake Kills Tourists and Imperils Egyptian Lifeline

snippet: The attack in broad daylight by a helicopter raised new questions about the competence of security forces and the prevalence of the militants they were hunting.
